page.title: 04Parish Magazine Of Hanley's
page.content: The magazine is self-financing and retails at 5p.a month (ther are 12 issues a year).The cost of the covers is financed by those local enterprises who advertise on 3 of the 4 sides,and the front cover at present features three symbols of the village-a pelica ,the Lechmere family crest,for Hanley Castle,a swan for Hanley Swan,and a cockle shell for Welland (the symbol of St.James of Compostella to whom their church is dedicated).The committee meet monthly to discuss the magazine's content,after which the editor assembles the material.This is typed out,voluntarily on A5 paper and then collated together with any illustrations,by the editor so that it may be transfered onto carbon stencils cut by an electronic rotary scanner; the stencils are then duplicated on an electric duplicator.
